required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of CS-3150 in Hypertensive Patients With Type 2 Diabetes and Albuminuria
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of CS-3150 to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety in Hypertensive Patients With Type 2 Diabetes and Albuminuria.

brief_summary.textblock: To examine antihypertensive effect and safety of administration of CS-3150 in combination with ARB or ACE inhibitor in hypertensive patients with type 2 diabetes and albuminuria.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in sitting systolic and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in sitting systolic and diastolic blood pressure

secondary_outcome.measure: Time course of systolic and diastolic blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Time course of systolic and diastolic blood pressure

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients achieving blood pressure control
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving blood pressure control

secondary_outcome.measure: Change rate from baseline in urine-albumin-to-creatinine ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Change rate from baseline in urine-albumin-to-creatinine ratio.

arm_group.description: CS-3150 1.25 to 2.5, 5mg, orally, once daily after breakfast for 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female subjects aged 20 to 80 years at informed consent
- Subjects with type 2 diabetes and albuminuria (urine albumin-to-creatinine ratio ≥ 30, < 1000 mg/g/Cr)
- Subjects with hypertension (Sitting SBP ≥ 140 mmHg, <180 mmHg and Sitting DBP ≥ 80 mmHg, <110 mmHg
- Treatment with an ARB or ACE inhibitor
- eGFR ≥ 30 mL/min/1.73m^2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Secondary hypertension or malignant hypertension
- Type 1 diabetes
- Secondary glucose intolerance
- Diagnosed with non-diabetic nephropathy
- Serum potassium level < 3.5 or ≥ 4.8 mEq/L

clinical_study.keyword: Hypertension with Type 2 Diabetes and Albuminuria

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data (IPD) and applicable supporting clinical trial documents may be available upon request at https://vivli.org/. In cases where clinical trial data and supporting documents are provided pursuant to our company policies and procedures, Daiichi Sankyo will continue to protect the privacy of our clinical trial participants. Details on data sharing criteria and the procedure for requesting access can be found at this web address: https://vivli.org/ourmember/daiichi-sankyo/
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Studies for which the medicine and indication have received European Union (EU) and United States (US), and/or Japan (JP) marketing approval on or after 01 January 2014 or by the US or EU or JP Health Authorities when regulatory submissions in all regions are not planned and after the primary study results have been accepted for publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Formal request from qualified scientific and medical researchers on IPD and clinical study documents from clinical trials supporting products submitted and licensed in the United States, the European Union and/or Japan from 01 January 2014 and beyond for the purpose of conducting legitimate research. This must be consistent with the principle of safeguarding study participants' privacy and consistent with provision of informed consent.
